timeline.bodyText: This file is missing a licence header, and I'm actually not sure what should we put here, since parts of the code were copied from OpenCensus IIUC?
timeline.author: nilebox
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+package io.opentelemetry.opencensusshim;

replies.bodyText:
We have this pattern for including two licenses, yeah in any file with copies let's use it
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/master/context/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/context/Context.java#L6
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: nit: Do we even need to perform these checks if the implementation is a no-op?
timeline.author: nilebox

replies.bodyText: This seems like less of a nit, and more of a problem. If it throws exceptions on bad inputs, it's not a no-op, I think.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
I actually just copied all of this from https://github.com/census-instrumentation/opencensus-java/blob/f0e78ba5a10165cce2b63809bfdfe3e34b1eb456/impl_core/src/main/java/io/opencensus/implcore/trace/NoRecordEventsSpanImpl.java
Not sure why there are checks in the OC implementation, happy to remove the checks here though if it makes more sense
replies.author: zoercai

replies.bodyText: If OC users are fine with that behavior, then it's cool. We've taken a different approach in OTel, but this is fine if it's what users are used to.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Why protected?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: this has been deleted
replies.author: zoercai

timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
Context Interaction:

a wrapped.Span is added to the OC context, we add the "wrapped span" to the Otel Context
a blank oc Span is added to the OC context, we add a "blank span" to the Otel Context
a otel.Span is added to the Otel Context, we create a wrapper and add it to OC Context.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: @bogdandrutu yep I've updated everything now, could you please take another look?
replies.author: zoercai

replies.bodyText: I am not sure this is what I meant. I was trying to suggest to use composition when implementing the OC required types and delegate everything to otel.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
I'm quite confused. I'm delegating everything to oTel after creating the oTel span here: https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/pull/2060/files#diff-4b913d64466c48a3f3149a7e7c9345886e02931d69396c8223fc855818f3e261R166-R167
Could you explain what you were expecting a bit more?
replies.author: zoercai

replies.bodyText: I've moved some of the logic from startSpan() to the methods overriding OC methods, such as addParentLinks() and setSpanKind() to set Otel fields directly. The rest depend on the sampler, which does all of https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/pull/2060/files#diff-4b913d64466c48a3f3149a7e7c9345886e02931d69396c8223fc855818f3e261R109-R146 to determine the kind of span that should be created. Since the sampler takes in OC parameters (parent, hasRemoteParent, traceId, spanId, name, parentLinks), I don't think I can map and delegate this nor its parameters to Otel, especially since the sampler could be implemented by the user.
replies.author: zoercai

replies.bodyText: @bogdandrutu If I'm not mistaken, we can't eagerly delegate to OTel because it doesn't have setRecordEvents or setSampler. Having setSampler on OTel's SpanBuilder seems useful to me but guess it's a spec change. setRecordEvents we shouldn't need since pretty sure that can just be implemented as setSampler(ALWAYS_OFF). If we could do it, then all the logic in this class goes away I think (would need mapSampler to shim the sampler)
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I see, maybe we can stick with what we have here for the moment, and look into ways to improve this.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
Add a comment something like OpenCensus's code for BinaryFormat is in the implementation, not API. Since we don't want to depend on the implementation for shim users, we reimplement it here.
Also, let's just copy https://github.com/census-instrumentation/opencensus-java/blob/0a2f5799a2809b84e4c0da4b2cb743b798ca0fc8/impl_core/src/main/java/io/opencensus/implcore/trace/propagation/BinaryFormatImpl.java 100% - there seems to be no benefit in mapping into the OTel types here
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I think only OpenCensus instrumentation will interact with these spans, unless for some reason a user decided to get an OC parent/child span from a library and change its status. I've updated the Otel methods to delegate to the otelSpan just in case though.

timeline.message: Add tests for text format propagator

timeline.bodyText: Do you think we need to support the OC clock? I'd recommend removing this line if it seems reasonable.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
The clock is created at https://github.com/zoercai/opentelemetry-java/blob/4e7d8b25cb24466f5a678cfd67dd5769fe599d4e/opencensus-shim/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/opencensusshim/OpenTelemetryTraceComponentImpl.java#L33
and is publicly available via Tracing.java, so it seems like I should use it here just in case. Let me know if you think it's unnecessary though!
replies.author: zoercai

replies.bodyText: Customizing the OC clock seems like a very small use case - it seems unlikely to do any better than what OTel will provide (e.g., we updated the Clock in OTel to use Java 9+ for improved precision) so it could be considered a good thing to not respect the OC clock. But no personal opinion food for thought on what could be better here.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I've removed the clock
replies.author: zoercai

timeline.author: anuraaga
